intro: Mabea belizensis, commonly known as the Belize mabea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
